songs.full_title: Animals by Maroon 5
songs.title: Animals

description.plain:
The timid second track on Maroon 5’s fifth studio album, V. It uses animal metaphors to describe a breakup that might not last. It was released as the second single shortly after its release.

Its music video came out September 29th. In it, Adam plays a butcher stalking a woman (played by his wife).

Both the video’s premise and final scenes have attracted controversy for their sexual content, liberal blood use, and perceived glamorization of unhealthy relationships.

songs.full_title: Bet My Heart by Maroon 5
songs.title: Bet My Heart

description.plain:
“Bet My Heart” consists as the fifth track off of Maroon 5’s sixth studio album, Red Pill Blues, which was published on November 3, 2017.

The track contains consistent guitar strumming and drum beats which show how, regardless of the slight transition to pop-infused sounds, the band manage to maintain their original rock vibes within their new work. It speaks of how Levine bets on how he will get his love interest to be with him, and thinks about the probabilities of her remain with him.

songs.full_title: Cold by Maroon 5 (Ft. Future)
songs.title: Cold

description.plain:
“Cold” is the second single released by Maroon 5, featuring rapper Future, from their sixth studio album. Adam Levine confirmed on Twitter that the song would make its live debut on The Ellen Show on February 15.

Following the success of “Don’t Wanna Know” that peaked at number six on the Billboard Hot 100, Maroon 5 released “Cold,” which talks about how to deal with relationships and breakups. The song was released just in time for Valentine’s Day along with its music video the next day.

songs.full_title: Daylight by Maroon 5
songs.title: Daylight

description.plain:
“Daylight” is a song by American pop rock band Maroon 5, released as the third single from their fourth studio album, Overexposed. Lyrically, the song is about coming to the realization that one has to move on from an old relationship, but not fully wanting to end the relationship quite yet.

The song peaked at #7 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, making it the third single from the album to reach the top 10 on the Hot 100.

The song peaked at #7 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, making it the third single from the album to reach the top 10 on the Hot 100.

songs.full_title: Don't Wanna Know by Maroon 5 (Ft. Kendrick Lamar)
songs.title: Don’t Wanna Know

description.plain:
“Don’t Wanna Know” is a song about past lovers. Adam focuses on not wanting to know what his ex-lover has been up to or who she’s been with since they broke up, while Kendrick shows his ex what she’s been missing.

This is Maroon 5’s first single since 2015’s “This Summer’s Gonna Hurt Like A Motherfucker” off of the re-release of their fifth album, V.

description.plain: Information about the original version with Kendrick Lamar can be seen here. Some radio stations play a version of the song without Kendrick Lamar. The difference between this solo version, and the original version, is that Kendrick Lamar’s part is replaced with a new Adam Levine bridge. Also, another difference is that during the final chorus, there are a few lines in the chorus that are repeated.

songs.full_title: Give a Little More by Maroon 5
songs.title: Give a Little More

description.plain:
“Give a Little More” is the second song off of Maroon 5’s third studio album, Hands All Over.

Openly erotic with its throbbing drumbeat, suggestive lyrics, and high yowls, it was chosen as the second single from the album. It charted on the Billboard Hot 100 in 2010, but only at #86. However, it did hit #1 in South Korea.

songs.full_title: Happy Christmas (War Is Over) by Maroon 5
songs.title: Happy Christmas (War Is Over)

description.plain:
“Happy Christmas (War Is Over)” is the 21st song in Maroon 5’s 2010 album Hands All Over, which included hit single “Moves Like Jagger”. This album helped propel the band to mainstream music, with their next album V in 2015 and other new songs like “Don’t Wanna Know”, and “Cold” being released in the years to follow.

This song is a cover of John Lennon’s song, which is a plea to humanity to unite and put aside all differences to celebrate Christmas. This time around, the song lacks the classic choir that sings behind the lead singers in most of the song’s covers. Featuring only a somber piano tune, long with Adam Levine’s vocals, “Happy Christmas (War Is Over)” could be arguably the most heartfelt cover to the song ever recorded.

annotatable.title: Happy Christmas (War Is Over)

body.plain:
“Happy Christmas (War Is Over)” is the 21st song in Maroon 5’s 2010 album Hands All Over, which included hit single “Moves Like Jagger”. This album helped propel the band to mainstream music, with their next album V in 2015 and other new songs like “Don’t Wanna Know”, and “Cold” being released in the years to follow.

This song is a cover of John Lennon’s song, which is a plea to humanity to unite and put aside all differences to celebrate Christmas. This time around, the song lacks the classic choir that sings behind the lead singers in most of the song’s covers. Featuring only a somber piano tune, long with Adam Levine’s vocals, “Happy Christmas (War Is Over)” could be arguably the most heartfelt cover to the song ever recorded.

songs.title: In Your Pocket

description.plain: “In Your Pocket” is the seventh track on Maroon 5’s fifth studio album, V. Lyrically, the song is about a cheating girlfriend, one who pretends she has nothing to hide, but still won’t let her lover see her phone as proof that she is innocent of the charge.

songs.full_title: It Was Always You by Maroon 5
songs.title: It Was Always You

description.plain:
The electronically-charged third track on Maroon 5’s fifth studio album, V, is yet another courteous love affair.

Accompanied by a chilling synthetic soundscape, the songwriter reflects on the dreams that he had been having about a special girl, realizing that girl had been his friend the whole time.
